verses.verse: The words<WH1697> of king<WH4428> Lemuel<WH3927>; the oracle<WH4853> which his mother<WH517> taught him<WH3256>.
What <WH1248>, my son? and what<WH1248>, O son of my womb<WH990>? And what<WH1248>, O son of my vows<WH5088>?
Give <WH5414> not thy strength<WH2428> unto women<WH802>, Nor thy ways<WH1870> to that which destroyeth<WH4229> kings<WH4428>.
It is not for kings<WH4428>, O Lemuel<WH3927>, it is not for kings<WH4428> to drink<WH8354> wine<WH3196>; Nor for<WH335> princes<WH7336> to say<WH7941>, Where is strong drink?
Lest they drink<WH8354>, and forget<WH7911> the law<WH2710>, And pervert<WH8138> the justice<WH1779> due to any that is afflicted<WH1121>.
Give <WH5414> strong drink<WH7941> unto him that is ready to perish<WH6>, And wine<WH3196> unto the bitter<WH4751> in soul<WH5315>:
Let him drink<WH8354>, and forget<WH7911> his poverty<WH7389>, And remember<WH2142> his misery no more<WH5999>.
Open <WH6605> thy mouth<WH6310> for the dumb<WH483>, In the cause<WH1779> of all such as are left<WH1121> desolate<WH2475>.
Open <WH6605> thy mouth<WH6310>, judge<WH8199> righteously<WH6664>, And minister<WH1777> justice to the poor<WH6041> and needy<WH6041>.
A worthy<WH2428> woman<WH802> who can find<WH4672>? For her price<WH4377> is far<WH7350> above rubies<WH6443>.
The heart<WH3820> of her husband<WH1167> trusteth<WH982> in her<WH2637>, And he shall have no lack of gain<WH7998>.
She doeth<WH1580> him good<WH2896> and not evil<WH7451> All the days<WH3117> of her life<WH2416>.
She seeketh<WH1875> wool<WH6785> and flax<WH6593>, And worketh<WH6213> willingly<WH2656> with her hands<WH3709>.
She is like the merchant-ships<WH935>; She bringeth her bread<WH3899> from afar<WH4801>.
She riseth<WH6965> also while it is yet night<WH3915>, And giveth<WH5414> food<WH2964> to her household<WH1004>, And their task<WH2706> to her maidens<WH5291>.
She considereth<WH2161> a field<WH7704>, and buyeth<WH3947> it<WH6529>; With the fruit of her hands<WH3709> she planteth<WH5193> a vineyard<WH3754>.
She girdeth<WH2296> her loins<WH4975> with strength<WH5797>, And maketh strong<WH5797> her arms<WH2220>.
She perceiveth<WH2938> that her merchandise<WH5504> is profitable<WH2896>: Her lamp<WH5216> goeth not out<WH3518> by night<WH3915>.
She layeth<WH7971> her hands<WH3027> to the distaff<WH6418>, And her hands<WH3709> hold<WH8551> the spindle<WH3601>.
She stretcheth out<WH6566> her hand<WH3709> to the poor<WH6041>; Yea<WH7971>, she reacheth forth her hands<WH3027> to the needy<WH34>.
She is not afraid<WH3372> of the snow<WH7950> for her household<WH1004>; For all her household<WH1004> are clothed<WH3847> with scarlet<WH8144>.
She maketh<WH6213> for herself carpets of tapestry<WH4765>; Her clothing<WH3830> is fine linen<WH8336> and purple<WH713>.
Her husband<WH1167> is known<WH3045> in the gates<WH8179>, When he sitteth<WH3427> among the elders<WH2205> of the land<WH776>.
She maketh<WH6213> linen<WH5466> garments and selleth<WH4376> them<WH5414>, And delivereth girdles<WH2289> unto the merchant<WH3669>.
Strength <WH5797> and dignity<WH1926> are her clothing<WH3830>; And she laugheth<WH7832> at the time<WH3117> to come<WH314>.
She openeth<WH6605> her mouth<WH6310> with wisdom<WH2451>; And the law<WH8451> of kindness<WH2617> is on her tongue<WH3956>.
She looketh well<WH6822> to the ways<WH1979> of her household<WH1004>, And eateth<WH398> not the bread<WH3899> of idleness<WH6104>.
Her children<WH1121> rise up<WH6965>, and call her blessed<WH833>; Her husband<WH1167> also<WH1984>, and he praiseth her, saying:
Many <WH7227> daughters<WH1323> have done<WH6213> worthily<WH2428>, But thou excellest them all<WH5927>.
Grace <WH2580> is deceitful<WH8267>, and beauty<WH3308> is vain<WH1892>; But a woman<WH802> that feareth<WH3373> Jehovah<WH3068>, she shall be praised<WH1984>.
Give <WH5414> her of the fruit<WH6529> of her hands<WH3027>; And let her works<WH4639> praise<WH1984> her in the gates<WH8179>.
